definition: to lean against/to rely on/on the basis of/no matter (how, what etc)/proof
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy

sentences.english: It does this by challenging the end user for credentials.
sentences.chinese: 为此，它要求终端用户提供凭据。

sentences.english: On the credentials tab specify the account name and password.
sentences.chinese: 在选项卡上指定的凭据的帐户名和密码。

sentences.english: The user which connects to a virtual host using credentials.
sentences.chinese: 使用安全凭据连接到虚拟主机的用户。

sentences.english: His abasement was the pledge of His exaltation.
sentences.chinese: 他的自卑是他升高的凭据。

sentences.english: It is difficult to obtain reliable evidence.
sentences.chinese: 这很难取得可靠的凭据。

sentences.english: Enter the credentials for an administrative user on the established cluster.
sentences.chinese: 在已经建立的集群上为管理用户输入凭据。

sentences.english: By policy, the police impolitely sliced the politician' s politics books.
sentences.chinese: 凭据政策，警方不客气的把政客的书籍切成了薄片。

sentences.english: Winds, heavy rain, thunder, lightning shaking the love and support.
sentences.chinese: 狂风，暴雨，雷轰，电闪摇撼着我爱你的凭据。

sentences.english: These can be passed to the remote object through the remote object proxy.
sentences.chinese: 可以通过远程对象代理将这些凭据传递给远程对象。

sentences.english: Together, the timestamp and the window determine the expiration time of the credential.
sentences.chinese: 时间戳和窗口一起来确定凭据的过期时间。

sentences.english: Now he has slandered her and said, 'I did not find your daughter to be a virgin.'
sentences.chinese: 信口说她，说，我见你的女儿没有贞洁的凭据。

sentences.english: It is recommended that the signin credentials be supplied at runtime.
sentences.chinese: 我们建议在运行时提供登录凭据。

sentences.english: But what are proofs of love that Paul alludes to?
sentences.chinese: 但保罗说的爱心的凭据又是什么呢？

sentences.english: This login information is captured in a credential store.
sentences.chinese: 此登录信息在凭据库中捕获。

sentences.english: With the root of this word, take a guess. What is the meaning of this word?
sentences.chinese: 凭据词根猜一猜这个复词的意念是甚么？

sentences.english: Saying, This is the blood of the testament which God hath enjoined unto you.
sentences.chinese: 这血就是神与你们立约的凭据。

definition: mere verbal statement cannot be taken as proof (idiom)
bill of warrant (certificate, allowing one to collect money or valuables)
